Anonymous.Definition: Anonymous means something is created without giving it a name. It is often used for temporary objects, types, or functions.

Argument.Definition: Arguments are the actual values you pass to a method, constructor, or function when you call it. These values get assigned to the corresponding parameters so they can be used wherever they are passed.

Concatenation.Definition: Concatenation combines two or more values into a single value. It is most commonly used to join strings together.

Conditional.Definition: Member access that is only allowed when the preceding value is not {c:color-blue keyword}null{/c}. If it is, evaluation of the expression is stopped and returns {c:color-blue keyword}null{/c} immediately. {c:keyword}?.{/c} is also known as the {c:bold}conditional-member access operator{/c}.

GenericMethod.Definition: A method designed to work with multiple types and must be passed a {c:bold}generic type argument{/c} when invoked. The generic type argument passed in will replace the {c:bold}generic type parameter{/c} defined in the method signature.

GenericType.Definition: A type that must be supplied a {c:bold}generic type argument{/c} when used. The generic type argument passed in will replace the {c:bold}generic type parameter{/c} in the type definition.

ImplicitlyTyped.Definition: Implicitly typed means the type is determined automatically by the compiler. The type is still fixed, even though it is not written explicitly.

ImportedNamespace.Definition: A segment of a {c:bold}using directive{/c} that imports a {c:color-blue keyword}namespace{/c} into the current file. Namespaces are imported to allow their types to be referenced {c:bold}without fully qualified names{/c}.

InterpolatedValue.Definition: An interpolated value is an expression embedded inside an interpolated string. Its result is inserted into the string at runtime.

Nullable.Definition: Nullable indicates that a value can also be {c:color-blue keyword}null{/c}. It is used to represent the absence of a value safely.

ReturnValue.Definition: A return value is the result produced by a method or function. It is sent back to the caller when execution finishes.

ShortCircuit.Definition: When the left-hand expression determines the result, {c:bold}short circuit{/c} and skip evaluation of the right-hand expression.

TypeParameter.Definition: A type parameter is a {c:bold}placeholder{/c} that is replaced by a concrete type when a generic type or method is used.
